dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in both fast flowing rivers and still waters (Stawikowski & Werner, 1998).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: North America:  Atlantic slope, Panuco River drainage, and Soto La Marina River in Mexico.

dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; freshwater; pH range: 7.0 - 8.0; dH range: 9 - 20

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Both parents tend the clutch; female takes care for the eggs, male defends the territory.

There is 1 barcode sequence available from BOLD and GenBank.

Below is the sequence of the barcode region Cytochrome oxidase subunit 1 (COI or COX1) from a member of the species.

See the BOLD taxonomy browser for more complete information about this specimen.

Other sequences that do not yet meet barcode criteria may also be available.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Herichthys carpintis
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Herichthys carpintis." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 9 May 2013, 09:01 UTC. 25 Jan 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Herichthys_carpintis&oldid=588942772>.
dataObjects.description:
Herichthys carpintis, the lowland cichlid, pearlscale cichlid or green Texas cichlid, is a species of cichlid endemic to Mexico where it occurs in the Pánuco River drainage and the Soto La Marina River. It reaches a maximum size of 17 centimetres (6.7 in) SL.[1]

References[edit]

  1. ^ Froese, Rainer and Pauly, Daniel, eds. (2013). "Herichthys carpintis" in FishBase. April 2013 version.
This Cichlidae-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
